com.team08storyapp

Class StoryFragment

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.team08storyapp.StoryFragment
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class StoryFragment
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    StoryFragment is a model class representing the pages of a Chose Your Own Adventure Story. An StoryFragment has the following properties:
    • Story Fragment Id to uniquely identify the Story Fragment within a Story.
    • Story Text that makes up the body text of a Story Page.
    • Photos that illustrate what is happening in this page of the Story.
    • Choices that allow the reader to decide what happens next in the Story resulting in a different page being next.
    • Annotations that users added to contribute there opinions on the Story.
    These properties are able to be accessed through the constructor or through public getters/setters.
    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0 November 8, 2013
    Author:
    Michele Paulichuk, Alice Wu, Ana Marcu, Jarrett Toll, Jiawei Shen
    See Also:
    Story, Photo, Choice, Annotation, Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      StoryFragment(int storyFragmentId)
      A constructor for creating a Story Fragment object used when initializing a sample story for testing.
      StoryFragment(int storyFragmentId, java.lang.String storyText)
      A constructor for creating a Story Fragment object used to help setup the pages to display for a Story to be read or for saving to when an Author is writing a Story.

    • Constructor Detail

      • StoryFragment

        public StoryFragment(int storyFragmentId)
        A constructor for creating a Story Fragment object used when initializing a sample story for testing. The following properties must be know:
        • Story Fragment Id
        Parameters:
        storyFragmentId - The unique identifier used to identify the current Story Fragment.

      • StoryFragment

        public StoryFragment(int storyFragmentId,
             java.lang.String storyText)
        A constructor for creating a Story Fragment object used to help setup the pages to display for a Story to be read or for saving to when an Author is writing a Story. The following properties must be known:
        • Story Fragment Id
        • Story Text
        Parameters:
        storyFragmentId - The unique identifier used to identify the current Story Fragment.
        storyText - The text that makes up the body of the Story Fragment.

      • getPhotos

        This getter method gets the illustrations set to illustrate the Story being told in the Story Fragment.

      • setPhotos

        This setter method sets the illustrations set to illustrate the Story being told in the Story Fragment.
        Parameters:
        photos - The photos to set in the Story Fragment for the Story.

      • getChoices

        public java.util.ArrayList<Choice> getChoices()
        This getter method gets the possible choices set to the Story Fragment.

        If this Story Fragment is the end of the Story the list will be empty, otherwise it should always have at least one choice.

        Returns:
        The choices a reader has in moving the Story along from the current Story Fragment.

      • setChoices

        public void setChoices(java.util.ArrayList<Choice> choices)
        This setter method sets the possible choices set to the Story Fragment.

        If this Story Fragment is the end of the Story do not use setter, this will be set up as an empty list in the constructor.

        Parameters:
        choices - The choices to set for that will be available for this Story Fragment.

      • getAnnotations

        public java.util.ArrayList<Annotation> getAnnotations()
        This getter method gets the possible annotations set to the Story Fragment by users who have read the Story.
        Returns:
        The annotations readers have provided for this Story Fragment.

      • setAnnotations

        public void setAnnotations(java.util.ArrayList<Annotation> annotations)
        This setter method sets the possible annotations set to the Story Fragment by users who have read the Story.
        Parameters:
        annotations - the annotations to set that readers have given for this Story Fragment.

      • getRandomChoice

        public int getRandomChoice()
        This getter method gets whether this Story Fragment has the option to have it's choices chosen at random by the user.
        Returns:
        the Random Choice attribute (1 = on, 0 = off) of the current fragment that the author chose

      • setRandomChoice

        public void setRandomChoice(int randomChoice)
        This setter method sets whether this Story Fragment has the option to have it's choices chosen at random by the user.
        Parameters:
        randomChoice - The random choice attribute 1 for on and 0 for off for the current fragment

      • getFragmentPermission

        public int getFragmentPermission()
        This getter method gets whether this Story Fragment is read only.
        Returns:
        the fragmentPermission attribute of the current fragment, 0 for read only, 1 for readable and editable

      • setFragmentPermission

        public void setFragmentPermission(int fragmentPermission)
        This setter method sets whether this Story Fragment is read only.
        Parameters:
        fragmentPermission - 1 for readable and editable, 0 for read only
